title: The Optimal Condition on the Growth of Green Haematococcus Pluvialis as one of the Future Natural Resources
summary: This paper focuses on optimizing the growth conditions for Haematococcus pluvialis, a microalgae species used as a natural source of astaxanthin. The study uses experimental design to determine the optimal initial inoculum concentration, nutrient concentrations, and growth medium type for H. pluvialis growth in the green stage phase.
methodology: Experimental design using Central Composite Design (CCD) with variables such as initial inoculum concentration, nutrient concentrations, and growth medium type
research_outcomes: The study found that BG-11 medium is better than Walne medium for H. pluvialis growth rate, and a constant supply of nutrients is necessary during microalgae cultivation.

title: Malabsorption and motor dysfunction in patients with small bowel amyloidosis
summary: This paper discusses the relationship between malabsorption, motor dysfunction, and amyloidosis in patients with small bowel involvement. The authors investigate the pathological findings and clinical signs of two cases of nonfamilial amyloidosis, confirming previous findings that amyloidosis can cause intestinal motor dysfunction.
methodology: The authors used endoscopic biopsy specimens and necropsy material to examine the small intestine for amyloid deposits.
research_outcomes: The study confirms that amyloidosis can cause malabsorption and motor dysfunction in patients with small bowel involvement. The authors also investigate the pathological findings and clinical signs of two cases of nonfamilial amyloidosis.

title: High-resolution satellite rainfall estimation from SM2RAIN applied to basin as
summary: This study explores the potential of Sentinel-1 soil moisture estimates in deriving high-resolution rainfall estimates at 1km resolution in the Po river basin areas in Italy, using the SM2RAIN algorithm. However, the ML/AI impact is minimal as the focus is on satellite data and hydrologic modeling.
methodology: The study uses Sentinel-1 soil moisture estimates and compares them with ASCAT derived rainfall estimates and gauge+radar derived estimates using the SM2RAIN algorithm.
research_outcomes: The study finds that the high-resolution rainfall estimates from S1-RT1 show improved performance compared to ASCAT, but still have issues with intermittence and noise. The authors suggest revising their methodology to improve the accuracy of rainfall estimation.

title: An Analysis of Lexical Stress in English Pronunciation of Indo-European Words Loaned to Turkish by Turkish Speakers of English
summary: This study investigates lexical stress placement in English pronunciation of Indo-European words loaned to Turkish by Turkish speakers of English. The research aims to increase awareness of prosodic features and improve learners' communicative competence, particularly in the area of suprasegmental features such as stress patterns.
methodology: The study uses a quantitative approach, analyzing audio files recorded from participants reading loanwords in isolation and in sentences. The data is analyzed through Praat to determine primary stress placement.
research_outcomes: The findings reveal a statistically significant difference in the accuracy of primary stress placement between native speakers and Turkish speakers of English. Negative L1 transfer was detected, but participants receiving treatment made significant progress.

title: Investigation of Serum Seladin-1/DHCR24 Levels in Breast Cancer Patients
summary: This study investigates the relationship between serum seladin-1 levels and clinical characteristics of patients with non-metastatic breast cancer. The results show lower seladin-1 levels in breast cancer patients compared to controls, but no statistically significant association was found between tumor size and seladin-1 levels.
methodology: The study used histopathological methods to diagnose breast cancer and analyzed demographic and laboratory data. Serum seladin-1 levels were determined using an ELISA kit.
statistics: independent-samples t-test, Mann-Whitney U test, chi-square or Fisher exact tests
research_outcomes: Lower serum seladin-1 levels in breast cancer patients compared to controls. No statistically significant association was found between tumor size and seladin-1 levels.

title: 11th LANE Conference: Photonic Technologies
summary: This paper presents the proceedings of the 11th LANE conference, focusing on photonic technologies. The conference features keynote speakers, plenary discussions, and presentations on laser material processing, E-Mobility, Additive Manufacturing, and social aspects. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not mentioned or used in this paper.
methodology: The methodology involves organizing a platform for exchange of relevant content and encouraging attendees to build contacts in the community.
research_outcomes: The conference provides important information and inspiration for future topics, with a focus on photonic technologies.

title: SPORT STUDENT TEACHERS’ DISCOURSES ABOUT FEMALE ATHLETES IN MIXED MARTIAL ARTS
summary: This qualitative study examines the discourses of sport student teachers about female athletes in Mixed Martial Arts (MMA). The research aims to understand the constitutive process of MMA and its space in the sports context, as well as the gender relations at stake. The study uses focus groups with undergraduate students in Sport and Physical Education, analyzing their speeches and identifying themes related to MMA, women's participation, and health impact.
methodology: Qualitative approach using focus group research technique, inductive analysis of data, thematic analyses, and hierarchical coding trees
research_outcomes: The study identifies the discursive order that sustains and legitimized sport in society, attributing strength to men and fragility to women. It also highlights the resistance of women's bodies perceived as fragile and their ability to enter masculinizing forms of sport like MMA.

title: Deaths of Despair and the incidence of excess mortality in 2020
summary: This paper analyzes excess mortality not directly attributed to COVID-19 in 2020, arguing that it reflects the effects of social distancing and the pandemic recession on so-called “deaths of despair” (from drug overdose, suicide, and alcohol abuse). However, the author's conclusions are undermined by methodological flaws and errors.
methodology: The paper decomposes excess deaths into reported COVID deaths, unreported COVID deaths, and non-COVID excess deaths, but the estimates of non-COVID excess deaths are based on flawed assumptions.
research_outcomes: The study concludes that excess mortality in 2020 may be due to social distancing protocols, but the evidence is inconclusive.

title: Validity and reliability of the coronavirus anxiety scale: Turkish adaptation for nurses
summary: This paper evaluates the validity and reliability of the Coronavirus Anxiety Scale (CAS) in a Turkish population of nurses. The study uses descriptive design, convenience sampling, and online survey to collect data from 165 nurses. The CAS is adapted for Turkish language and evaluated using content validity, construct validity, and reliability methods. The results show high content validity (CVI = 0.98), one-factor structure explained 61.24% of the total variance, and good internal consistency (Cronbach's Alpha = 0.84). However, ML/AI is not used in this paper.
methodology: Descriptive design, convenience sampling, online survey
statistics: Cronbach's Alpha, factor analysis, correlations, Bartlett's test and KMO Test
research_outcomes: High content validity (CVI = 0.98), one-factor structure explained 61.24% of the total variance, good internal consistency (Cronbach's Alpha = 0.84)

title: Improvement of the safety of multi-floor housing
summary: This paper proposes a biological method of phytodesign to improve the safety in common areas of multi-storey buildings by using phytoncides plants. The authors developed an assortment of 11 species of shade-resistant plants that can purify the air and reduce the growth of pathogens.
methodology: The methodology involves selecting optimal range of phytoncidal tropical and subtropical plants based on climatic conditions and plant classification.
research_outcomes: The authors found that for effective air purification, 5-7 plants with a height from 60 cm to 1.0-1.5 m are needed. They proposed three options for artificial illumination to preserve the decorative and physiological features of the plants.

title: Free vibrations of linear viscoelastic polymer cantilever beams
summary: This paper theoretically describes the free vibrations of cantilever slender beams made of polymers, which are viscoelastic materials. The Euler-Bernoulli assumption is used to model the behavior of these materials, and the theory is validated against experimental data collected on metal and polymer beams.
methodology: Theoretical description using the Euler-Bernoulli beam theory
research_outcomes: The paper shows that the simple Euler-Bernoulli theory is relevant to reproducing experimental data obtained with the free vibration experiment for the cantilever beam.

title: TIME-DEPENDENT MODELLING OF QUASI-BRITTLE MATERIALS WITH A STRONG DISCONTINUITY APPROACH
summary: This paper presents a discrete model for time-dependent behaviour of quasi-brittle materials, specifically concrete structures. The model uses the strong discontinuity approach (DSDA) to simulate cracking and accounts for creep and shrinkage. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this research.
methodology: The methodology involves implementing a finite element model using the DSDA to address time-dependent behaviour of cracked concrete structures.
research_outcomes: The proposed model was validated against experimental data and compared with another study using the smeared crack approach. The results show that both models can provide reasonable estimates, but the discrete framework offers potential for future studies on explicit implementations of other components.

title: The Effect of Lateral Lifting Tasks on Hand Grip and Pinch Strength Measurements
summary: This paper investigates the relationship between lateral transfer distances and hand grip and pinch strengths in manual material handling tasks. The study found that distances of 1.0 m, 1.25 m, and 1.5 m did not affect hand grip and pinch strengths, but postures and movements varied based on distances.
methodology: The study used a repeated measure one-way MANOVA and graphs to analyze the data from an experiment with 30 male participants.
research_outcomes: The results showed that lateral transfer distances did not affect hand grip and pinch strengths, but postures and movements varied based on distances.

title: Change of 7Be decay rate under compression
summary: This paper investigates the effect of compression on the decay rate of 7Be, a radioactive isotope. The authors implant 7Be in Pd and Pb lattices to measure its decay rate under different pressures. They find that the decay rate increases by (0.82±0.16)% in Pd compared to Pb, but density functional calculations underpredict this result by a large factor.
methodology: The authors use a combination of experimental and theoretical methods to study the effect of compression on the decay rate of 7Be. They implant 7Be in Pd and Pb lattices using a proton beam, then measure its decay rate using a high-efficiency HPGe detector.
research_outcomes: The authors find that the decay rate of 7Be increases by (0.82±0.16)% in Pd compared to Pb, but density functional calculations underpredict this result by a large factor.

title: Finite element simulation of vertical temperature gradients in a standard W40×235 steel beam
summary: This paper presents a finite element analysis to study the vertical temperature gradient in a standard W40×235 steel beam under environmental thermal loads. The research focuses on understanding the distribution of temperatures along with the depth of the beam, and how it affects the structural performance of the bridge.
methodology: Finite element analysis using COMSOL Multiphysics
research_outcomes: The results show that the vertical temperature gradient approaches zero with stabilized beam temperature after midnight and up to the sunrise, while it continuously increases with time reaching its maximum values at approximately 2:00 PM.

title: Ecohydrology of the Syrdarya River under irrigation water management in the Fergana Valley
summary: This paper examines ecohydrology and irrigation water management in the Fergana Valley, highlighting challenges such as water scarcity, mismanagement of resources, and environmental degradation. The study focuses on the Syrdarya River basin, analyzing hydrological processes, water quality, and the impact of human activities on the ecosystem.
methodology: The paper uses a comprehensive approach, combining literature review, analysis of secondary data, and statistical methods to assess ecohydrological conditions and irrigation water management in the region.
research_outcomes: Key findings include the importance of balancing inhabitants' and ecosystem's water needs, the impact of climate change on hydrologic cycles, and the need for sustainable management of water resources. The study highlights the potential of groundwater as a source for irrigation and recommends rehabilitation and maintenance works to improve drainage systems.

title: Evolutionary consequences of delaying intervention for monkeypox
summary: This paper examines the evolutionary consequences of delaying intervention for monkeypox, highlighting the importance of rapid and sustained intervention to prevent the pathogen from adapting to humans. The authors suggest that pathogens with a reproductive number (R) just above 1 have a higher probability of evolution during the timeframe in which the number of cases remains low.
methodology: The paper uses a combination of mathematical modeling and epidemiological analysis to investigate the impact of delaying intervention on the evolution of monkeypox.
research_outcomes: The study finds that rapid intervention can prevent the pathogen from adapting to humans, reducing the chance of evolution and improving control efforts. The authors also highlight the importance of monitoring and controlling zoonoses with R0 close to 1.

title: Pixton as a digital teaching tool to encourage the writing skill
summary: This paper explores the use of Pixton, a digital storytelling tool, to enhance students' writing skills in English as a Foreign Language (EFL). The authors argue that traditional teaching methods can be ineffective for EFL learners, and that technology can provide a more engaging and interactive way to learn. Pixton is presented as a valuable resource for teachers to encourage student creativity and motivation.
methodology: The study uses a qualitative approach, with a focus on the use of Pixton as a digital storytelling tool in EFL classrooms.
research_outcomes: The paper concludes that Pixton can be an effective tool for improving students' writing skills and motivation in EFL learning. However, it also highlights some limitations of the platform, such as the limited number of backgrounds available.

title: Morphemes’ Ternate Malay Languages in North Maluku Province, Indonesia
summary: This paper analyzes functional morphemes in the Ternate Malay Language, using a descriptive method to identify heterogeneous functional morphemes. The study concludes that there are differences in affixes forms of functional morphemes in the language.
methodology: Descriptive method
research_outcomes: The study found differences in affixes forms of functional morphemes in the Ternate Malay Language.

title: dQTG.seq: A comprehensive R tool for detecting all types of QTLs
summary: This paper presents dQTG.seq, a new R software package for detecting quantitative trait loci (QTLs) in bi-parental segregation populations. The tool uses extreme phenotype individuals and integrates various statistical indicators to identify QTLs.
methodology: The methodology involves using extreme phenotype individuals and integrating various statistical indicators, including G', SmoothLOD, deltaSNP, and ED.
research_outcomes: dQTG.seq is shown to be effective in detecting QTLs, particularly for extremely over-dominant and small-effect genes.

title: Latent Network Capital and Gender in Crowdfunding: evidence from the Kiva platform
summary: This paper examines how latent network capital affects crowdfunding success, specifically focusing on gender disparities. It proposes a novel method to capture latent network capital using project centrality within a latent network of projects built around funders' choices. The study finds that women-led projects have lower elasticity of funding raised compared to male-led ones, exacerbating the existing gender gap.
methodology: The paper develops a novel method to capture latent network capital using project centrality within a latent network of projects built around funders' choices. It uses Social Network Analysis literature to derive standard notions of Centrality.
research_outcomes: The study finds that women-led projects have lower elasticity of funding raised compared to male-led ones, exacerbating the existing gender gap.

title: Diversified Wound Management with a Honey-Based Ointment
summary: This paper presents a honey-based ointment, Wound Occlusive, as an effective treatment for various wound types. The ointment's mechanism of action involves the combination of zinc oxide, xylitol, and hyaluronic acid, which facilitate wound healing by reducing inflammation, promoting tissue regeneration, and inhibiting biofilm formation.
methodology: The study employed a case series approach, where two patients with different types of wounds were treated with Wound Occlusive. The treatment protocol involved cleaning the wound with saline and applying Wound Occlusive as a thick paste, followed by an absorbent dressing.
research_outcomes: The study found that Wound Occlusive significantly improved wound healing in both patients, reducing inflammation, edema, and exudate. The ointment's ease of application and frequency of use also enhanced patient compliance.

title: Hermitian Matrix Definiteness from Quantum Phase Estimation
summary: This paper presents a hybrid algorithm for classifying the definiteness of a Hermitian matrix, combining classical preprocessing with quantum phase estimation. The algorithm shows good performance, achieving 97% correct classifications with few qubits, and has significant computational cost advantages over classical methods for restricted classes of matrices.
methodology: The algorithm uses the Quantum Phase Estimation (QPE) algorithm to estimate the sign of the eigenvalues of a Hermitian matrix. It combines this with classical preprocessing to determine the definiteness of the matrix.
research_outcomes: The algorithm achieves high accuracy in classifying the definiteness of Hermitian matrices, and has significant computational cost advantages over classical methods for restricted classes of matrices.

title: The Influence of Consumer Insight, Religiosity, and Trust on Decisions to Become a Customer at Bank Syariah Mandiri Bandar Lampung Branch Office
summary: This study examines the effect of consumer insight, religiosity, and trust on customer decisions to use Islamic banking services at Bank Syariah Mandiri Syariah Branch Office Bandar Lampung. The research uses a quantitative approach and multiple linear regression analysis to determine the relationship between these variables.
methodology: The study used a non-probability sampling method and purposive sampling technique, with a sample of 100 respondents who are customers of Bank Syariah Mandiri Bandar Lampung Branch Office. Data was collected through questionnaires using an interval scale.
research_outcomes: The results show that consumer insight, religiosity, and trust have a significant effect on customer decisions to use Islamic banking services at Bank Syariah Mandiri Syariah Branch Office Bandar Lampung. The study supports previous research findings that religiosity has a positive influence on saving behavior in Islamic banks.

title: Zoonotic Risks of Sleeping with Pets
summary: This study investigates the zoonotic risks associated with sleeping with pets, specifically focusing on the presence of potential pathogens in dogs and cats. The research found that 58% of pets slept on their owner's bed, with 30% of them under the blankets. The study detected Enterobacteriaceae in 86% of dogs and 32% of cats, highlighting the risk of zoonotic infections.
methodology: The study used a pilot design to investigate the presence of zoonotic pathogens in pets that sleep with their owners. Owners were questioned about their health and pet's health, sleeping habits, diet, and parasite control. Sampling was performed on fur, footpads, and animal beds.
research_outcomes: The study found a significant presence of Enterobacteriaceae in pets that sleep with their owners, highlighting the risk of zoonotic infections.
